verses.verse: But now they that are younger<WH6810> than I have me in derision<WH7832>, whose fathers<WH1> I would have disdained<WH3988> to have set<WH7896> with the dogs<WH3611> of my flock<WH6629>.
Yes<WH4100>, where might the strength<WH3581> of their hands<WH3027> profit me<WH3624>, in whom old age was perished<WH6>?
For want<WH2639> and famine<WH3720> they were solitary<WH1565>; fleeing<WH6207> into the wilderness<WH6723> in former time<WH570> desolate<WH7722> and waste<WH4875>.
Who cut up<WH6998> mallows<WH4408> by the bushes<WH7880>, and juniper<WH7574> roots<WH8328> for their food<WH3899>.
They were driven forth<WH1644> from among<WH1460> men<WH7321>, (they cried after them as after a thief<WH1590>;)
To live<WH7931> in the clifts<WH6178> of the valleys<WH5158>, in caves<WH2356> of the earth<WH6083>, and in the rocks<WH3710>.
Among the bushes<WH7880> they brayed<WH5101>; under the nettles<WH2738> they were gathered together<WH5596>.
They were sons<WH1121> of fools<WH5036>, Yes<WH1121>, sons of base men<WH8034>: they were viler<WH5217> than the earth<WH776>.
And now am I their song<WH5058>, Yes<WH4405>, I am their byword.
They abhor<WH8581> me<WH7368>, they flee far from me<WH2820>, and spare not to spit<WH7536> in my face<WH6440>.
Because he has loosed<WH6605> my cord<WH3499>, and afflicted<WH6031> me<WH7971>, they have also let loose the bridle<WH7448> before me<WH6440>.
Upon my right<WH3225> hand rise<WH6965> the youth<WH6526>; they push away<WH7971> my feet<WH7272>, and they raise up<WH5549> against me the ways<WH734> of their destruction<WH343>.
They mar<WH5420> my path<WH5410>, they set forward<WH3276> my calamity<WH1942>, they have no helper<WH5826>.
They came<WH857> upon me as a wide<WH7342> breaking<WH6556> in of waters<WH8478>: in the desolation<WH7722> they rolled themselves upon me<WH1556>.
Terrors<WH1091> are turned<WH2015> upon me<WH7291>: they pursue my soul<WH5082> as the wind<WH7307>: and my welfare<WH3444> passes away<WH5674> as a cloud<WH5645>.
And now my soul<WH5315> is poured out<WH8210> upon me<WH3117>; the days of affliction<WH6040> have taken hold upon me<WH270>.
My bones<WH6106> are pierced<WH5365> in me in the night season<WH3915>: and my sinews<WH6207> take no rest<WH7901>.
By the great<WH7230> force<WH3581> of my disease is my garment<WH3830> changed<WH2664>: it binds me about<WH247> as the collar<WH6310> of my coat<WH3801>.
He has cast<WH3384> me into the mire<WH2563>, and I am become like<WH4911> dust<WH6083> and ashes<WH665>.
I cry<WH7768> unto you<WH6030>, and you do not hear me<WH5975>: I stand up, and you regard me not<WH995>.
You are become<WH2015> cruel<WH393> to me<WH6108>: with your strong hand<WH3027> you oppose yourself against me<WH7852>.
You lift me up<WH5375> to the wind<WH7307>; you cause me to ride<WH7392> upon it<WH4127>, and dissolve my substance<WH8454>.
For I know<WH3045> that you will bring<WH7725> me to death<WH4194>, and to the house<WH1004> appointed<WH4150> for all living<WH2416>.
But he will not stretch out<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> to the grave<WH1164>, though they cry<WH7769> in his destruction<WH6365>.
Did not I weep<WH1058> for him that was in trouble<WH7186>? was not my soul<WH5315> grieved<WH5701> for the poor<WH34>?
When I looked<WH6960> for good<WH2896>, then evil<WH7451> came<WH935> unto me<WH3176>: and when I waited for light<WH216>, there came<WH935> darkness<WH652>.
My bowels<WH4578> boiled<WH7570>, and rested<WH1826> not<WH3117>: the days of affliction<WH6040> prevented me<WH6923>.
I went<WH1980> mourning<WH6937> without the sun<WH2535>: I stood up<WH6965>, and I cried<WH7768> in the congregation<WH6951>.
I am a brother<WH251> to dragons<WH8577>, and a companion<WH7453> to owls<WH1323>.
My skin<WH5785> is black<WH7835> upon me<WH6106>, and my bones are burned<WH2787> with heat<WH2721>.
My harp<WH3658> also is turned to mourning<WH60>, and my organ<WH5748> into the voice<WH6963> of them that weep<WH1058>.
